QuestionStem: Read about the reproductive processes of each animal. Decide if the process is an example of asexual reproduction, sexual reproduction, or both types of reproduction.

cells.label: male bluegill
cells.imageAlt: This photograph shows a male bluegill fish guarding a group of eggs.

cells.label: Male bluegills create nests for female bluegills to lay their eggs. The male bluegills fertilize the eggs with their sperm. Males guard the eggs until they hatch.
jellyfish
cells.imageAlt: This photograph shows a jellyfish in water.

cells.label: Male and female jellyfish release sperm and eggs into the water. A fertilized egg develops into a larva that will grow into a polyp. The polyp will release a portion of its body into the water that will grow into an adult jellyfish.
coral reef
cells.imageAlt: In this photograph, a coral reef is surrounded by fish.

cells.label: Corals can reproduce in a variety of ways. One way is by a process that can produce a new coral from a fragment. A portion of the coral may be broken off by a boat, a person, or an animal. The broken piece can grow into a new coral.

CorrectFeedback: The bluegill eggs are the result of the union of egg and sperm so this is an example of sexual reproduction. The jellyfish has a life stage that results from union of egg and sperm and a life stage that results from one individual so the jellyfish uses both types of reproduction. Reproduction by fragmentation is a type of asexual reproduction because there is only one parent.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Decide how many parents are involved in each of the reproductive processes described.
IncorrectFeedback: Decide how many parents are involved in each of the reproductive processes described.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: The bluegill eggs are the result of the union of egg and sperm so this is an example of sexual reproduction. The jellyfish has a life stage that results from union of egg and sperm and a life stage that results from one individual so the jellyfish uses both types of reproduction. Reproduction by fragmentation is a type of asexual reproduction because there is only one parent.
